title: @Riot, About players who intentionally ban the champ you are picking
body:
Rito, can you PLEASE make it an automatic suspension if anyone bans the champion you have hovered to pick? I have had this happen FOUR times in the last week alone. Every time it has been intentional as well. This happens even though I have said nothing in the chat.

If the enemy team bans, that's fine, they didn't know who you were going to pick. Having your own teammates troll you completely ruins the game.

replies.body:
1) This is rich coming from one of the most ferverent (at least in the far past) Yasuo QQers.
2) If the champion is FotM or popular and strong and you're not the first two picks, it is perfectly acceptable to ban a teammate's pick. Rather not have to face them.

Yes, I have complained about Yas for a LONG time and Riot finally woke up and realized I was right all along. That's why he's being reworked. Win me.

Second, if you are afraid of facing that champ, at least talk to the team about someone being able to first pick them before you just ban them outright. I own every champ in the game and I gladly pick champs for people on my team because I like to win games.

Third, I just wanted to throw in that this happens in NORMALS. There is zero excuse for banning someone's champ in Norms, ever.

You don't get to dictate other people's game for them. If they don't want a xayah in their game, they can ban xayah. I don't care who wants to play it. The ban mechanic is seen as taking priority over the pick mechanic - there's always going to be a loser. However, considering Riot expects people not to be one-trick ponies, Riot considers the player's right to ban who they want more important than you getting your first pick of champ.
But it's perfectly fine for them to dictate their game on you. Sorry, your argument is completely invalid. There are plenty of one tricks out there.
Riot does not support one tricks. They force you to purchase a certain number of champions to play draft, and you're expected not to be a one trick if you're playing draft.

The only reason you have to purchase X number of champs is to have champs if yours is banned or to fill other positions. That's literally it. Probably the best non-pro player in NA is a one trick. In fact the upper ELO is mostly one tricks who just have played long enough to get good with a few champs. 

So don't tell me Riot doesn't support OTPs.
If Riot supported OTPs, they'd form a way to allow OTPs to ensure they were permitted their champ in ranked/draft. They don't support OTPs. If you believe me or not, I don't care.

They allow one tricks to be banned because if a one trick has a meta champ, it's pretty much GG before the game even starts. 

Riot caters heavily to Korea and Korea has more one tricks than any region. Just man up and admit you're wrong on this one.

Actually, there are differences in policy between regions, so your argument is invalid.

Riot does not support OTPs in draft pick mode. Regardless of what you're saying.

Trying to insult my manhood does not change the fact you're the incorrect one here.
you forgot to mention if its a new champ we're all banning it if its on our team

I understand wanting to ban new champs. However, there are people who do get to put in a lot of games on them on the PBE and Norms before they take them ranked. Not to mention the work you can do in practice mode now. 

If they take a new champ and feed like a buffet, just report them.

feeding like a buffet will not get someone punished. 

you probably would be considered harassing them if you were to ask people to report the buffet owner.

If someone feeds that hard, it's always intentional. If you are behind, you don't fight, period. When you are 0/3 against a 3/0 and continue to try and fight them, you are intentionally feeding at that point. All you have to do is just stay barely within XP range until you can get ganks or items.

sure. keep thinking like that.

those people you claim to be inting won't be punished.

but if you harassed them, you'll get punished in due time.
